00035 #include <vector>
00036 #include "../common/common.h"
00037 #include "../common/kernel.h"
00038 #include "../common/experiment.h"
00039 #include "../common/abs.h"
00040 #include "../common/poptmx.h"
00041 
00042 using namespace std;
00043 
00045 struct clargs {
00046   Path command;               
00047   Path listname;                                
00048   bool idealworld;               
00049   string slicedesc;                             
00050   Path outmask;                         
00051   Filter filter_type;           
00052   Dcenter center;               
00053   unsigned nof_threads;              
00054   bool beverbose;                               
00055   bool SaveInt;                                 
00056 
00058   clargs(int argc, char *argv[]); 
00059 };
00060 
00061 
00062 clargs::
00063 clargs(int argc, char *argv[]) :
00064   beverbose(false),
00065   idealworld(false),
00066   nof_threads(0),
00067   SaveInt(false),
00068   outmask("reconstructed-<list>-@.tif"),
00069   filter_type()
00070 {
00071 
00072   poptmx::OptionTable table
00073         ("All-in-one absorption-based CT reconstruction.",
00074          "Performs all procedures for the reconstruction:\n"
00075          "1) reads the text file describing the array of input files"
00076          " (foreground-background pairs).\n"
00077          "2) removes the backgrounds in accordance with this file.\n"
00078          "3) constructs the sinograms of the slices requested in the slice string.\n"
00079          "4) reconstructs the sinograms.\n"
00080          "All these procedures can be performed on the step-by-step basis using tools"
00081          " \"bg\", \"sino\" and \"ct\", but this approach saves all intermediate"
00082          " results on the hard disk and therefore a lot of time is spent for the"
00083          " I/O operations, memory allocations, etc. Also much more disk space is used.");
00084 
00085   table
00086         .add(poptmx::NOTE, "ARGUMENTS:")
00087         .add(poptmx::ARGUMENT, &listname, "list",
00088          "List of the input images.", AqSeries::Desc)
00089         .add(poptmx::ARGUMENT, &outmask, "result mask",
00090                  "Output result mask.", MaskDesc, outmask)
00091 
00092         .add(poptmx::NOTE, "OPTIONS:")
00093         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &slicedesc, 's', "slice",
00094                  "Slices to be processed.", SliceOptionDesc, "<all>")
00095         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &idealworld, 'w', "idealworld",
00096       "Suppose we live in the ideal world.", IdealWorldOptionDesc)
00097         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &center, 'c', "center",
00098                  "Variable rotation center.", DcenterOptionDesc, toString(0.0))
00099         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &SaveInt,'i', "int",
00100       "Output image(s) as integer.", IntOptionDesc)
00101         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &filter_type, 'f', "filter",
00102                  "Filtering window used in the CT.", FilterOptionDesc, filter_type.name())
00103         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &nof_threads, 't', "threads",
00104                  "Number of threads used in calculations.",
00105                  "If the option is not used the optimal number is"
00106                  " calculated automatically.", "<auto>")
00107         .add_standard_options(&beverbose)
00108         .add(poptmx::MAN, "SEE ALSO:", SeeAlsoList);
00109 
00110   if ( ! table.parse(argc,argv) )
00111         exit(0);
00112   if ( ! table.count() ) {
00113         table.usage();
00114         exit(0);
00115   }
00116 
00117   command = table.name();
00118 
00119   // <list> : one required argument.
00120   if ( ! table.count(&listname) )
00121     exit_on_error(command, "Missing required argument: <list>.");
00122 
00123   // <result mask> : one more argument may or may not exist
00124   if ( ! table.count(&outmask) )
00125         outmask = upgrade(listname, "reconstructed-") + "-@.tif";
00126   if ( string(outmask).find('@') == string::npos )
00127         outmask = outmask.dtitle() + "-@" + outmask.extension();
00128 
00129 }
00130 
00131 
00132 
00134 int main(int argc, char *argv[]) {
00135 
00136   const clargs args(argc, argv);
00137   const AqSeries list(args.listname);
00138   const ABSexp expr(list);
00139   int
00140     thetas=expr.thetas(),
00141     pixels=expr.pixels(),
00142     slices=expr.slices();
00143   const CTrec rec(pixels, expr.contrast(), args.nof_threads, args.filter_type);
00144   const string sliceformat = mask2format(args.outmask, slices);
00145   const vector<int> sliceV = slice_str2vec(args.slicedesc, slices);
00146   const SinoS sins(expr, sliceV, args.beverbose);
00147 
00148   Map sinogram(thetas, pixels), result(pixels, pixels);
00149   ProgressBar bar(args.beverbose, "reconstruction", sliceV.size());
00150 
00151   for (unsigned slice=0 ; slice < sliceV.size() ; slice++ ) {
00152         sins.sino(slice, sinogram);
00153         if ( args.idealworld )  sinogram = cutone(sinogram);
00154         rec.reconstruct(sinogram, result, args.center(slice+1));
00155         SaveImage( toString(sliceformat, sliceV[slice]+1), result, args.SaveInt);
00156         bar.update();
00157   }
00158 
00159   exit(0);
00160 
00161 }
